stories.text:
Does not exist... But I sure hope it was. (Sorry for the clickbait).

These stupid clickbait takes too much of my time and attention,if there was something that just filter articles/websites automatically (or even just tag them) I think my life will be much more efficient.

Do you think it is even possible, what would you envision?
stories.title: Phone-wide clickbait detection and filteration

stories.text: The recent shutdown of SSLPing and related comments made me think. There are so many generous individuals or organisations who host open source services for free on their infrastructure. I'm thinking of federated networks like Matrix or Mastodon or utilities like Jitsi, Cyberchef or SSLPing. Useful things if you know where to find them. I know of a few gists and pastebins floating around but this is a poor solution in my opinion. Wouldn't it make sense to have a centralized or federated database with such tools combined with servers where they are hosted? Does this already exist somewhere?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a reliable source to find freely hosted open-source software?
How to create your first content calendar
